title: The Terry McLaurin trade request, explained: Why it could linger, and which teams should be interested
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: A defensive end? Parsons asks Cowboys for trade
content: Cowboys star defensive end Micah Parsons announces in a social media post that he has requested a trade amid stalled contract extension talks.

title: Yanks release Stroman with Gil return imminent
content: The Yankees have released right-hander Marcus Stroman. Stroman went 3-2 with a 6.23 ERA in nine starts for New York this season.

title: D.C. Council approves Commanders stadium deal
content: The Washington Commanders are going home to D.C. after the district's council voted Friday to approve a deal between the team and the city for a new stadium where its former home field -- RFK Stadium -- still stands.

title: Sources: USWNT's Sentnor to K.C. in record deal
content: United States women's national team forward Ally Sentnor has joined the NWSL-leading Kansas City Current from the Utah Royals, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Yamashita holding 3-shot lead at Women's Open
content: Miyu Yamashita carded a 7-under 65 on Friday at the Women's Open, propelling her to a three-shot lead over Rio Takeda after two rounds of play at Royal Porthcawl.

title: Manfred downplays CBA spat with Phillies' Harper
content: MLB commissioner Rob Manfred described his recent confrontation with Phillies star Bryce Harper related to looming labor negotiations as "not all that significant."

title: Wrigley Field chosen to host 2027 All-Star Game
content: The Cubs and Wrigley Field will host the 2027 MLB All-Star Game. It will be the fourth time Wrigley has held the game and the first since 1990.

title: Gaudreau Family 5K raises $500K for playground
content: The first 5K held in the memory of John and Matthew Gaudreau helped raise more than $500,000, enough to break ground later this year on an accessible playground at the special education school where the hockey players' mother works.

title: üèà Fantasy FB Do Not Draft list: CMC and more
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in drafts this summer.

content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands post-trade deadline
content: There was a lot of action across baseball ahead of Thursday's trade deadline. How did the moves impact each club's standing?

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: 'We thought it was dead': How Washington beat the odds -- and its past -- to return to RFK
content: Owner Josh Harris grew up watching Washington in Super Bowls and is thrilled to renew that history with a move back to RFK.

title: The 7 biggest surprises and disappointments of the WNBA season
content: From the Valkyries surpassing expectations to the Aces falling short on theirs, here's what we didn't see coming.

content: After finishing 15th in the Premier League last season, Man United are still a mess and their recent transfers show they haven't wised up.

content: Chelsea's path to sign to Xavi Simons from RB Leipzig has hit a roadblock. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could get done?

title: Lapsed fan's guide to 2025 SummerSlam: Two-nighter has something for everyone
content: Our FAQ guide on the latest WWE storylines, including John Cena's final SummerSlam and Jelly Roll's debut.

content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: What to know about the 2025 PFL welterweight and featherweight finals
content: Three weeks of PFL World Championships finals begin Friday with Thad Jean vs. Logan Storley and Jesus Pinedo vs. Movlid Khaybulaev.

content: Din Thomas makes his pick for Taira vs. Park and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

content: Gates transformed the tight end position, and he remains remarkable to those who witnessed his exploits.

content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

content: The PLL heads to Denver, with two games for the league's top team. Here's the schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: Forecaster for Week 19: Aug 4-10
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead in fantasy baseball with our forecaster, which features pitcher rankings, hitter ratings, schedule observations and more.

title: Risers and fallers: Fiebich trending up, Griner struggling
content: Leonie Fiebich has made the most of her increased opportunity on the Liberty, while Brittney Griner continues to have a down season.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Trinamool highlights unnatural death migrant worker in Pune, blames it on targeting of Bengali speakers
content: The deceased worker was identified as Dipu Das (28), a resident of Binnaguri panchayat area of Rajganj of West Bengal‚Äôs Jalpaiguri  district. The family members of the migrant worker claimed that he was murdered

title: Five get life term for 2018 Bulandshahr violence
content: Judgment comes more than six years after a police inspector and a local resident died in violence that erupted in a U.P. village over rumours of cow slaughter

title: Kerala, Chhattisgarh units of BJP at odds over nuns‚Äô arrest; will get ‚Äòjustice‚Äô, insists Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: Amid protests by the Christian community and political parties in Kerala demanding release of the nuns, the State unit continued its effort to mend bridges with Church leaders.

title: Can OPS succeed where other AIADMK leaders who joined DMK failed?
content: There has been a long-standing trend of AIADMK leaders failing to make a mark in the elections after aligning themselves with the DMK

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs engine of progress: education for all
content: As we proudly send off another batch of students from the most disadvantaged backgrounds to the most prestigious educational institutions in the country, we must look back at Tamil Nadu‚Äôs legacy in pushing to make education accessible to all; the success stories are not isolated, they reflect a systemic change

title: Indian fuel exports escape Trump's tariff net, no Russian penalty yet
content: Earlier, the U.S. President had announced plans to impose a 25% tariff on India, along with an additional penalty, citing concerns over the country's energy and defence ties with Russia, as well as existing trade barriers

title: Bengal BJP ups ante against ‚Äòfake‚Äô voters, accuses Trinamool of ‚Äòthreatening‚Äô BLOs
content: CM Mamata Banerjee has told BLOs not to harass ‚Äògenuine‚Äô voters. In a meeting, she told officials, ‚ÄúEC comes in during elections, but you all are employees of the State government‚Äù.

title: Enforcement Directorate conducts searches across five States in probe of alleged Axis Mutual Fund scam
content: ED searches in Delhi, Gujarat, Haryana, West Bengal, Punjab; Axis MF fund manager accused of exploiting confidential information to pre-emptively trade stocks, generating illicit profits of ‚Çπ200 crore

title: Sarah Joseph chosen for Kozhikode Corporation‚Äôs literary award
content: The literary award will be formally presented to Sarah Joseph at an event scheduled to be held here in mid-August

title: Upland farmers in Kozhikode seek Forest department‚Äôs intervention to strengthen rapid response team
content: Demands recently raised by a section of farmers have already been brought to the attention of the Forest department for prompt action, says local administrators from Koorachundu panchayat

title: Bihar SIR: 3.95 lakh voters not included in Patna
content: Three lakh voters missing from the draft roll in each of the three districts of East Champaran, Madhubani and Gopalganj; INDIA bloc leaders said that the Election Commission did not give any satisfactory answer to the questions raised by them

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. unveils Electronics Component Manufacturing Policy 2024‚Äì29
content: New five-year policy aims to strengthen electronics manufacturing, develop specialised clusters, and attract global players to build a robust semiconductor and display ecosystem in the State

title: August 8 last date to apply for ‚ÄòBest Teacher‚Äô awards in Andhra Pradesh
content: School Education Department to select teachers under three categories based on self-nomination, peer recommendation, and performance via LEAP app

title: K. Arul Jothi takes charge as security chief for Southern Railway
content: During his stint as Deputy Inspector General, Southern Railway in the 2019-20 COVID-19 period, he¬†spearheaded the RPF teams in organising the safe movement of migrant workers to various parts of the country through 503 Shramik Special Trains

title: Centre to withdraw order granting release of film Udaipur files, Delhi HC told
content: The court, which was hearing two pleas challenging the Centre‚Äôs decision allowing the release of the movie, directed the parties to appear before the government on August 4 and make their submissions.

title: M.P. High Court asks State to consider relocating burial site of toxic residue from Bhopal waste
content: Court directs government to submit plan for safe containment of incinerated residue in low seismic, uninhabited zone

title: Deletion of 65 lakh names just the beginning, says Yogendra Yadav on draft Bihar voter list
content: The political analyst urges that the Special Intensive Revision exercise should be scrapped right away

title: 'Fire vs lamp': China torches US for hypocrisy over trade with Russia
content: China has strongly refuted US accusations of supporting Russia's war efforts in Ukraine, labeling the claims as hypocritical. A Chinese representative at the UN criticized the US for its double standards, questioning why Washington can trade with Russia while restricting others. China maintains it hasn't provided lethal weapons and urged the US to cease blame-shifting and focus on ending the conflict.

title: Salesforce CEO Benioff: I keep asking CEOs, what AI are they using for big layoffs; and I think ‚Ä¶
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff disputes predictions of AI-driven job losses, asserting that AI primarily enhances human capabilities, despite Salesforce's own automation initiatives. He highlights AI's accuracy limitations, emphasizing the ongoing necessity of human oversight for fact-checking and strategic decision-making. Benioff anticipates AI will fuel a surge in small business creation by democratizing access to enterprise-level tools.

title: War of words: Trump deploys 2 nuclear subs over 'provocative' remarks by ex-Russian prez
content: Donald Trump ordered the deployment of two nuclear submarines to unspecified locations following a heated exchange with Dmitry Medvedev. The spat originated after Trump criticized Medvedev and imposed trade penalties on India for its ties with Russia. Medvedev responded with a provocative statement referencing Russia's Cold War nuclear strategy, prompting Trump's strong reaction and concerns about unintended consequences.

title: Not a single person accepted the offer: Murati on her team rejecting Zuckerberg‚Äôs $1 billion offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI talent faced a significant setback as Thinking Machines Lab, led by Mira Murati, reportedly rejected lucrative offers, some reaching a billion dollars, to join Meta's Superintelligence Lab. Murati's team prioritized independence and long-term vision over substantial financial gains, highlighting the allure of shaping AI's future outside a corporate giant.

title: Explosive in house or on bike? Malegaon blast judgement flags gaps in probe
content: A special NIA court's acquittal in the 2008 Malegaon blast case has revealed significant contradictions between the ATS and NIA investigations. The court cited flawed evidence, coercion, and inconsistencies in the agencies' accounts of the bomb's assembly and transportation. Concerns were raised about torture and fabricated evidence, casting doubt on the credibility of the ATS investigation.

title: Solar Eclipse that will see 'world to go dark for six minutes' on August 2
content: Contrary to viral social media claims, the world will not experience a six-minute blackout on August 2, 2025. NASA confirms a total solar eclipse is scheduled for August 2, 2027, visible across parts of Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East.

title: Micah Parsons‚Äô message: "One Last Time" GIF sparks buzz ‚Äî Cowboys contract standoff deepens
content: Dallas Cowboys' star linebacker Micah Parsons is in a contract dispute with team owner Jerry Jones, sparking trade rumors. Parsons, seeking a deal similar to T.J. Watt, hinted at a potential departure if his demands aren't met. While expressing his desire to stay, Parsons acknowledged the front office's decision-making power.

title: "He keeps his distance": Travis Kelce saw Blake Lively drama coming ‚Äî trouble for Taylor Swift
content: Amid Blake Lively's legal issues involving Justin Baldoni, Travis Kelce has remained a supportive presence for Taylor Swift. Kelce, reportedly wary of Ryan Reynolds' "Hollywood" persona, has always prioritized Swift's well-being. The couples, once frequently seen together, have seemingly distanced themselves, with Lively and Reynolds absent from the recent Super Bowl, signaling a potential shift in Swift's friendships.

title: Shannon Sharpe lawsuit: $50M claim questioned ‚Äî payout reportedly far lower in OnlyFans case
content: NFL legend Shannon Sharpe settled a lawsuit with a 20-year-old OnlyFans model. The model initially sued Sharpe for $50 million, alleging sexual assault. Sources indicate Sharpe paid $23 million to resolve the case. Both parties acknowledge a consensual relationship. The model's lawyer confirmed a mutually agreed resolution. Sharpe has not commented publicly on the settlement. He continues his podcast work.

title: IND vs ENG 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj - The Last Man Standing
content: In a series where bowlers from both teams have been rotated, managed, and preserved, Mohammed Siraj has been the exception, running in hard every single time. On Friday, under a gloomy London sky, he brought India back with his lion-hearted effort and never-give-up attitude, something that, in the years to come, will be celebrated even more than his trademark ‚ÄúCelebrappeal,‚Äù remembered instead for his heart.

title: IND vs ENG | Prasidh breaks silence on heated exchange with Root: 'We are ...'
content: Prasidh Krishna downplayed his on-field exchange with Joe Root, calling it "just good banter" after a fiery second day. Krishna starred with 4 for 62 as India bowled England out for 247, restricting their lead to just 23 runs. India ended the day at 75/2 in their second innings, leading by 52, with Yashasvi Jaiswal unbeaten on 51.

title: 'Feel like slapping them': Telangana CM's shock remark on young scribes sparks outcry
content: Telangana's Chief Minister, A Revanth Reddy, is facing backlash after criticizing young journalists for lacking respect and etiquette at an event. His remarks sparked outrage, with press associations demanding clarification. Simultaneously, Reddy criticized political parties for owning media outlets and addressed concerns about social media misinformation.

title: IND vs ENG: Harry Brook does a Rishabh Pant - Who did it better? Watch
content: Harry Brook's audacious shot against Mohammed Siraj, reminiscent of Rishabh Pant, became the highlight of the rain-interrupted final Test. Brook's improvisational six, executed while losing balance, drew comparisons to Pant's fearless batting style. Despite India's earlier innings of 224 and England's quick start, Brook's moment of brilliance captured the attention of fans and commentators alike.

title: Ayesha Curry marks anniversary: heartfelt tribute to Steph ‚Äî love off the NBA cour
content: Ayesha Curry celebrated her 14th wedding anniversary with Stephen Curry, sharing heartfelt messages and date night photos on Instagram. She reminisced about their 17 years together, highlighting their enduring love and support through life's milestones. Ayesha also continues to expand her Sweet July Skin brand, recently launching new lip care products, with Stephen's unwavering support.

title: Where's the oil? Trump's Pak deal more strategic than realistic; move to pressure India?
content: Donald Trump's announcement of a deal to develop Pakistan's oil reserves is viewed with skepticism. Experts suggest it's a strategic move to counter China's influence and pressure India on trade, rather than a reflection of Pakistan's immediate hydrocarbon potential. The viability of these reserves remains unproven, requiring significant investment and time, especially given the risky locations.

title: 'There can be no discussion because ... ': Rijiju rules out Parl debate on Bihar SIR
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju has dismissed the possibility of a parliamentary discussion on Bihar's electoral roll revision, emphasizing the Election Commission's autonomy. Opposition parties, however, allege the revision aims to disenfranchise voters, disrupting Parliament proceedings with demands for a debate.

title: Epstein-Trump links: How did a real estate betrayal end their friendship?
content: Michael Wolff claims a $36 million Palm Beach mansion dispute triggered the downfall of Jeffrey Epstein, alleging Trump bought the property behind Epstein's back, sparking threats and accusations of money laundering. Wolff suggests Trump tipped off authorities about Epstein's activities, leading to his arrest.

title: 'ATS pressurised, evidence erased': Acquitted accused in Malegaon blast case
content: Sameer Kulkarni, acquitted in the Malegaon blast case, accuses Congress leaders and the Maharashtra ATS of framing Hindus for political gain. He alleges evidence manipulation and pressure on investigators. Retired inspector Mehiboob Mujawar supports this, claiming he was ordered to implicate RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat.

title: Peter Navarro says Donald Trump deserves Nobel in economics; cites global overhaul
content: White House trade advisor Peter Navarro suggests Donald Trump deserves a Nobel Prize in economics for fundamentally restructuring global trade through aggressive tariff policies and prioritizing American economic interests. Navarro highlights trade deals with countries like the UK, Japan, and the EU, along with ongoing talks with China, as evidence of Trump's success.

title: Explained: Why Nifty, Sensex have closed in red for 5th week in row
content: Indian stock markets faced a fifth consecutive week of losses, driven by persistent FII selling, concerns over India-US trade negotiations, and disappointing Q1 corporate earnings. Donald Trump's tariff imposition and a strengthening US dollar further contributed to the bearish sentiment.

title: Malayalam actor and mimicry star Kalabhavan Navas passes away at 51
content: Malayalam actor and mimicry artist Kalabhavan Navas died at 51. Found in a Kochi hotel room, he was famed for stage performances with Kalabhavan troupe and acted in many films since his 1995 debut. He is survived by wife Rehna Navas and was son of actor Aboobacker.

title: Trump's 25% tariff: India expects minimal impact; agri, GM food no-go areas in trade talks
content: The US imposition of 25% tariffs is expected to have minimal impact on India, with over half of Indian exports remaining unaffected due to existing exemptions. Trade between the two nations reached $131.8 billion in fiscal year 2024-25. India remains firm on not offering duty concessions for agricultural, dairy, and GM products, citing religious sentiments.

title: What is Legionnaires' disease? Know causes, symptoms, risk factors, prevention and more
content: Legionnaires' disease surfaces in Harlem, New York. The outbreak sickens many and causes one death. Legionella bacteria causes this pneumonia form. The bacteria thrives in water systems. Cooling towers and spas are potential sources. Symptoms include fever and respiratory issues. Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial. Prevention involves water system maintenance. Regular cleaning and disinfection are necessary. Read more below!

title: WWE SmackDown preview & streaming details: Full match card, confirmed segments, start timings & more
content: WWE SmackDown, airing live from Newark on August 1, 2025, will be the go-home show for SummerSlam. The episode features a face-off between John Cena and Cody Rhodes before their title match. Giulia defends her Women's United States Championship against Zelina Vega, and Los Garza issue an open challenge.

title: On right track: Railway Protection Force gets first-ever woman DG
content: In a historic move, Sonali Mishra, a senior IPS officer, has been appointed as the Director General of the Railway Protection Force (RPF), becoming the first woman to lead the 143-year-old security force. Mishra, a 1993-batch officer, brings over 30 years of experience from various prestigious organizations.

title: Bihar SIR: Over 65 lakh voters not included in draft rolls; Patna tops list
content: Bihar's draft electoral rolls omitted over 65 lakh names after a Special Intensive Revision. Patna had the highest number of missing voters. The Election Commission released new draft rolls, allowing citizens to file claims. Opposition parties criticized the exclusions, alleging they favored the ruling NDA. Parliament saw protests and adjournment over the issue. The Supreme Court emphasized en masse inclusion.

title: Swiss Luxury Faces Skyrocketing Prices As Trump's 39% Tariffs Kick In
content: Prices for the eponymous Swiss watches, Swiss chocolate and Swiss cheese could skyrocket in a week as a result of US President Donald Trump's trade war.

title: After 'Dead Hand' Threat, Trump Moves Two Nuclear Submarines Near Russia
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday has ordered two nuclear submarines to be positioned in the "appropriate regions" after comments made by former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev.

title: BJP Rajya Sabha Tally Crosses 100 For First Time Since 2022
content: In a boost for the ruling BJP, the party has crossed the 100 mark in the Rajya Sabha for the first time since April 2022, with three nominated members joining the party.

title: MK Stalin To Launch Big Health Outreach Campaign, Months Ahead Of Assembly Polls
content: With just eight months to go for the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, Chief Minister MK Stalin is set to launch a major health outreach campaign on Saturday, marking the second large-scale public initiative by his government in recent months.

title: "Feel Humiliated": Odisha Official Served Urine Mixed With Water By Peon
content: A junior engineer in Odisha claimed he was given water mixed with urine by the peon in his office, a charge the latter denied.

title: Encounter Between Forces, Terrorists In J&K's Kulgam, 3rd Gun Battle This Week
content: A fierce gun battle was underway between security forces and terrorists after a joint team of security forces launched an anti terrorist operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district today.

title: UP Man Arrested After Video Shows Him Spitting On Rotis: Cops
content: Police arrested a man here on Friday after a purported video showing him spitting on rotis he was making at a roadside eatery went viral on social media.

title: "Phone Felt Heavy, Dropped Laptop": Shubhanshu Shukla On Readjusting On Earth
content: Weeks after returning from the Axiom-4 mission, astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla on Friday shared experiences of readjusting to life on earth like how even a mobile phone felt heavy to hold and he dropped his laptop thinking it would float like in space.

title: Indonesia Volcano Belches Six-Mile Ash Tower
content: An Indonesian volcano spewed a 10-kilometre molten plume of ash topped by lightning into the sky, weeks after another huge eruption triggered dozens of flight cancellations in Bali.

title: Meghalaya's Conrad Sangma Calls For Release of Arrested Kerala Nuns
content: Two nuns, along with another person Sukhman Mandavi, were arrested on charges of them of forcibly converting three women and trafficking them.

title: Israeli Hostage Shown Gaza Starvation Footage, Palestinian Islamic Jihad Releases Video
content: The Palestinian Islamic Jihad terror group on Thursday posted a video of an Israeli-German hostage - Rom Braslavski, who had been held captive in the Gaza Strip in October 2023, an attack after which war sparked in the territory.

title: "Gravely Insulted": P Vijayan On National Award For 'The Kerala Story'
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has alleged the Centre is spreading misinformation by honouring a film that he claimed tarnished the Left-ruled state's image, hours after 'The Kerala Story' won two major titles at the 71st National Film Awards

title: "Big Headload Fell...": Railway Minister On What Led To Delhi Station Tragedy
content: A big headload that "fell from one of the passengers" led to the tragedy at New Delhi Railway Station that killed 18 people, Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said today in response to a member's query.

title: Mule Accounts, Kickbacks: Raids Find Rs 1,000-Crore Trail Behind Cattle Scheme
content: Illegal payments and kickbacks to government officials were part of the Rs 1,000 crore money trail uncovered following raids by the Enforcement Directorate in Hyderabad in connection with the TelanganaSheep Rearing Development Scheme.

title: Lalit Modi Posts New Photos Of Him And Vijay Mallya - This Time At Oval
content: Fugitive billionaires Lalit Modi and Vijay Mallya have now shared photos of them enjoying the India-England test match at the Oval in London.

title: Gang Runs Fake Tirumala Temple, Resort Booking Websites, Loots Visitors
content: The Bapatla district police in Andhra Pradesh have arrested a pan-India gang from Rajasthan responsible for creating fraudulent websites that mimicked popular tourism and temple booking portals.

title: India Flags "Inadvertent Air Violation" By Bangladesh Airline In June
content: India has raised an instance of "inadvertent air violation" by a Bangladesh domestic airline in June, so that steps are taken to prevent recurrence of such instances, the government informed Parliament on Friday.

title: US Promises Gaza Food Plan After Envoy Visit
content: President Donald Trump's special envoy promised a plan to deliver more food to Gaza after inspecting a US-backed distribution centre, as the UN human rights office said Israeli forces had killed hundreds of hungry Palestinians waiting for aid.

title: Bombay High Court To Get New Bench In Kolhapur From August 18
content: The Bombay High Court will get a new bench at Kolhapur district in western Maharashtra, which will be the fourth HC bench in the state, and its sittings will commence from August 18.

title: Lookout Notice Against Anil Ambani In Rs 3,000-Crore Loan Fraud Case: Sources
content: In more trouble for Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani, the Enforcement Directorate has issued a Look Out Circular against him in connection with the alleged Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud case, sources said on Friday.

title: Mirwaiz showers rare praise on J&K MPs for highlighting ‚ÄòKashmir plight‚Äô in Parliament
content: During Friday prayers, he asks Centre to¬†start ‚Äòengagement at all levels‚Äô as engagement at all levels is a ‚Äòfar cheaper and evolved narrative‚Äô

title: Passenger assaults co-traveller on IndiGo aircraft
content: The commotion happened as the passenger onboard Mumbai-Kolkata flight reported discomfort possibly due to a panic attack and requested to be deboarded leading to protests from others as it would cause a delay

title: No need for Karnataka to give land for cheap to IT firms: Priyank Kharge
content: The State‚Äôs IT Minister said that the government was promoting schemes to upskill talent, and that Karnataka benefited from early investments in the IT sector.

title: After Madras High Court rules on naming of ‚ÄòUngaludan Stalin‚Äô and ‚ÄòNalam Kaakum Stalin‚Äô schemes, Tamil Nadu government seeks clarification
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder Mohan accepted a request made by Advocate General P.S. Raman for an early hearing of the modification petition since the ‚ÄòNalam Kaakum Stalin‚Äô scheme was all set to be launched across the State on August 2

title: Encounters breaks out in J&K‚Äôs Kulgam
content: The encounter in Kashmir‚Äôs Kulgam comes just days after the security forces killed all the three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam terror attack in an encounter at Srinagar‚Äôs Dachigam area.¬†

title: Bangladesh envoy arrives in Tripura on three-day visit
content: Bangladesh High Commissioner visits Tripura, meets officials, inspects infrastructure projects, including Agartala-Akhaura rail link and Maitri Setu

title: SI, two constables arrested under POCSO Act in 2023 dismissed from service
content: Four police personnel reached Mukkombu in a car in plainclothes and consumed liquor and they spotted a 17-year-old girl with a 19-year-old youth and threatened them

title: Draft poll roll for Bihar is out, number of voters dip by 65 lakh
content: Election Commission publishes list after end of first phase of Special Intensive Revision; Patna draft roll has 3.95 lakh fewer voters than the list from January; many on the draft list may still be deprived of voting rights, says INDIA bloc

title: PM Modi to visit Varanasi on August 2, inaugurate many infra projects
content: PM Modi to inaugurate projects worth ‚Çπ2,200 crore in Varanasi, release PM Kisan Samman Nidhi, and address public meeting

title: Award for The Kerala Story invites a storm of criticism
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan says the jury has insulted the noble tradition of Indian cinema that stood for religious brotherhood and national integration by awarding a film that was built on lies to defame Kerala and spread communalism

title: Banakacherla: BRS blames Congress, BJP ‚Äòsilence‚Äô for AP going ahead
content: Harish Rao suggests AP to agree for Telangana‚Äôs rightful share in Krishna, Godavari waters before seeking its nod for PBLP

title: RTC workers to go on indefinite strike from August 5
content: The JAC, which represents employees of all four State-run transport corporations, has demanded a salary hike effective from January 1, 2024, and the settlement of pending arrears for 38 months from January 1, 2020, to February 28, 2023.

title: It may take one year to get death certificate of youths killed in Russia-Ukraine war
content: 13 Indian nationals recruited by Russia as mercenaries in the war with Ukraine remain in the Russian armed forces

title: Indian Navy‚Äôs Eastern Fleet arrives in Manila to bolster Indo-Pacific ties
content: The visits reaffirms the strategic importance of the event and the high-level engagement with the Philippine Navy, representing India‚Äôs maritime outreach in the region

title: Reservoirs across Andhra Pradesh brimming, Nagarjuna Sagar is 95% full
content: Hydropower generation has been stepped up significantly, authorities monitoring closely the inflows and the safety of reservoirs

title: Knowledge gained at ISS is going to be useful for our Gaganyaan mission: Group Captain Shukla
content: Group Captain Shukla, who is one of the four astronauts selected for the Gaganyaan mission, shares the highlights of the Ax-4 mission for the first time after returning to Earth

title: Health Minister hints at equipment going missing from Urology department
content: Show-cause notice issued to Haris Chirakkal was just a routine matter of procedure and not intended to be a vengeful action specifically against him, says Veena George

title: CM announces revival of Gandikota Festival; slated for December 26, 27
content: The region reckoned as ‚ÄòGrand Canyon of India‚Äô will be developed as an anchor tourist hub, says Chandrababu Naidu

title: CPI(M) urges NIA to appeal against acquittal of Malegaon blasts case accused¬†
content: The CPI(M) Polit Bureau says it was yet another case of undue delay and eventual denial of justice to the victims of a terrorist act by an extremist Hindutva group

title: Malayalam cinema wins four honours at National Film Awards; Urvashi and Vijayaraghavan get best supporting actor awards
content: Urvashi wins the best supporting actor (female) for her performance in Ullozhukku and Vijayaraghavan wins the award for the best supporting actor (male) for Pookkaalam, although technically both of them played the lead roles in these films

title: Chemists‚Äô body seeks action against startups for unauthorised tampering, repacking of medicine strips
content: ‚ÄòSuch tampering and repacking of medicine strips threaten patient safety, undermine ethical pharmacy practices, and erode confidence in the regulatory framework.‚Äô

title: Controversy breaks out in Maharashtra after ex-policeman claims he was asked to pick up Mohan Bhagwat over 2008 Malegaon blast case
content: Mehboob Mujawar, a former policeman who had worked in the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS), said he was pressured to arrest the RSS chief on directions from IPS officer Parambir Singh and other higher officials

title:
Andhra Pradesh to become single-use plastic-free by June 2026;¬†
Secretariat to set the example from this I-Day
content: Government will ban plastic bottles, cups, plates, sachets, stickers, and carry bags in the Secretariat and replace them with eco-friendly alternatives, says official

title: IND vs ENG: 'Just bat, ball and go home?' - KL Rahul rages at umpire after Prasidh-Root spat
content: Day 2 of the India-England Test at The Oval saw heated exchanges as Prasidh Krishna and Joe Root engaged in a verbal spat, requiring umpire intervention. Shortly after, KL Rahul confronted umpire Kumar Dharmasena, questioning restrictions on player interactions. Tensions escalated post-lunch, reflecting India's aggressive approach in this crucial game.

title: Man slaps 'nervous' passenger on IndiGo flight; handed over to security - video
content: On an IndiGo Mumbai-Kolkata flight, a passenger experiencing a panic attack was assaulted by a co-traveler. The incident occurred while the aircraft was taxiing, prompting the victim to request disembarkation. IndiGo has condemned the unruly behavior, handed over the assaulter to security, and initiated actions that could lead to a no-fly list designation.

title: Disquiet continues at Kerala University as V-C dissolves meeting over Registrar‚Äôs presence
content: Vice-Chancellor in-charge Mohanan Kunnummal abruptly ends meeting over the presence of suspended Registrar  K.S. Anil Kumar and Syndicate members J.S. Shijukhan and R. Rajesh, sparking heated arguments and disruptions.

title: Trellis-based horticulture gains ground in Kollidam block
content: As part of the programme, intercropping is encouraged with farmers cultivating bitter gourd, snake gourd, and ribbed gourd on trellis structures alongside crops like chilli and jasmine in flood-prone areas

title: Bamboo on your plate: KFRI brings a nutritious forest treasure to everyday diet
content: Bamboo shoot-based flakes and powder developed by Kerala Forest Research Institute aims to revolutionise healthy eating and rural livelihoods

title: Prajwal judgment has boosted the morale of survivors, say activists
content: The verdict has shown that law is the same for all and when implemented with the same spirit, justice is possible, said an activist

title: CM inaugurates revamped Muthukuda beach with boating facility and a TTDC restaurant
content: A slew of infrastructure facilities such as boathouse, visitor‚Äôs hall, sanitation complex, vehicle parking lot to attract tourists has been created at a cost of ‚Çπ 3.06 crore

title: 2K Games details gameplay changes for NBA 2K26
content: the ProPLAY Motion Engine has overhauled how players move on the court . the engine will reduce the phenomenon of players "skating" over the floor . this also includes a new collision system that aims to be more reliable than motion capture animations used previously .

title: Former Cubs outfielder Matt Szczur pays tribute to Ryne Sandberg with painting
content: former Chicago Cubs outfielder Matt Szczur paid homage to team icon Ryne Sandberg . his most recent project was a tribute to a Hall of Famer who died on Monday at 65 . he has built up a following on Instagram and TikTok (19,200 followers)

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022, or the volume of last year . the Twins traded back former star Carlos Correa, while the Athletics traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for Leo De Vries, one of the best prospects .

title: What were the Twins thinking? Who is MLB's team to beat? Making sense of the trade deadline's biggest surprises
content: the 2025 trade deadline is in the books . the San Diego Padres and Houston Astros made surprising moves that rocked the deadline . ESPN experts debate what's real moving forward . it's not because they're all sleeping giants .

title: Schedule superlatives: The toughest, easiest and most interesting matchups of 2025
content: college football is for the first time in history sharing revenue with athletes . the start of the 2025 season is less than a month away . it's time to hand out some superlatives, some flattering and some not so flattering .

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Falcons' Michael Penix Jr. has rough day
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL, and our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . we have updated depth charts for all 32 teams .

title: Liverpool look ready to defend Premier League title with new home, away kits
content: two of their 2025-26 jerseys officially unveiled at anfield on friday . this is the third time that the reds have partnered with the german sportswear giants in their history . the first home kit of this new era is very much classic fare .

title: 7.2cr voters in post-SIR Bihar draft roll, against 7.9cr before
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‚Äòprime‚Äô political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India‚Äôs neighbourhood.
